pr_title: Add builder support to Compose object api

timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: Override the validate(args) method and call validateSources from it (and any other validations that might be required before making the API call).
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: This line is not required as super.validateSse(url) internally does the same.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: Validations can be moved to a separate method
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: This is not required as super.validate(args) internally invokes validateBucketName anyway
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: Needs to be updated with the new builder based syntax
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: This method should internally call the new one.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: Did you mean testArgs ?
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText: These are just tags not the arguments for mint so testArgs seems logical. Its done in copyObject too.
replies.author: sinhaashish

timeline.bodyText: Since this method is not doing anything apart from calling the super method, it is not required anymore.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyText: null check needs to be done for sources
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Remove unwanted white spaces.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: This is CompleteMultipartUpload behaviour i.e. Error is returned with 200 OK. Here, you need to do XML parsing for CopyObjectResult
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: You need to pass ``args.region()` here.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: ObjectWriteArgs comes with headers and userMetadata. You would need to avoid extraHeaders and extraQueryParams usage unless required in examples and references.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: You would need to use these constants from ObjectWriteArgs
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: extraHeaders and extraQueryParams are always non-null. You would need to use them directly.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: We should deprecate this method and use other one.
timeline.author: balamurugana
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7515,17 +7643,16 @@ protected ObjectWriteResponse completeMultipartUpload(
    * @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException thrown to indicate missing of MD5 or SHA-256 digest library.
    * @throws XmlParserException thrown to indicate XML parsing error.
    */
-  @Deprecated

timeline.bodyText: Use String[] files. I prefer filenames instread of files
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: This method is not necessary. you could use removeObjects() then this for
timeline.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText: This method is used to make the functional Test less verbose as the same code was repeating  6 composeObject test . I have used removeObjects now.
replies.author: sinhaashish

timeline.bodyText: Sources should not be null or empty.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Why can't it be just  Xml.unmarshal(CopyObjectResult.class, response.body().charStream()); ? There is no need to read the body to a string and parse it later.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Do not call getRegion() for ObjectWriteResponse. You need to use args.region(). This is applicable everywhere.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Why not setting etag?
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: remove this commented code.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText:
Can't you use removeObjects() method available in this class?
Its better to call object removal first, then file removal later.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.message: Add builder support to Compose object api

timeline.bodyText: You would need to use args.validateSse(this.baseUrl);
timeline.author: balamurugana
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2557,29 +2566,102 @@ public void composeObject( InternalException, InvalidBucketNameException, InvalidKeyException, InvalidResponseException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, ServerException, XmlParserException { - if ((bucketName == null) || (bucketName.isEmpty())) { - throw new IllegalArgumentException("bucket name cannot be empty"); - } - checkObjectName(objectName); + ComposeObjectArgs.Builder builder = + ComposeObjectArgs.builder() + .bucket(bucketName) + .object(objectName) + .headers(Multimaps.forMap(headerMap)) + .sources(sources) + .sse(sse); - if (sources.isEmpty()) { - throw new IllegalArgumentException("compose sources cannot be empty"); - } + composeObject(builder.build()); + } - checkWriteRequestSse(sse); + /** + * Creates an object by combining data from different source objects using server-side copy. + * + * 
Example:{@code
+   * List sourceObjectList = new ArrayList();
+   *
+   * sourceObjectList.add(
+   *    ComposeSource.builder().bucket("my-job-bucket").object("my-objectname-part-one").build());
+   * sourceObjectList.add(
+   *    ComposeSource.builder().bucket("my-job-bucket").object("my-objectname-part-two").build());
+   * sourceObjectList.add(
+   *    ComposeSource.builder().bucket("my-job-bucket").object("my-objectname-part-three").build());
+   *
+   * // Create my-bucketname/my-objectname by combining source object list.
+   * minioClient.composeObject(
+   *    ComposeObjectArgs.builder()
+   *        .bucket("my-bucketname")
+   *        .object("my-objectname")
+   *        .sources(sourceObjectList)
+   *        .build());
+   *
+   * // Create my-bucketname/my-objectname with user metadata by combining source object
+   * // list.
+   * minioClient.composeObject(
+   *     ComposeObjectArgs.builder()
+   *        .bucket("my-bucketname")
+   *        .object("my-objectname")
+   *        .sources(sourceObjectList)
+   *        .build());
+   *
+   * // Create my-bucketname/my-objectname with user metadata and server-side encryption
+   * // by combining source object list.
+   * minioClient.composeObject(
+   *   ComposeObjectArgs.builder()
+   *        .bucket("my-bucketname")
+   *        .object("my-objectname")
+   *        .sources(sourceObjectList)
+   *        .ssec(sse)
+   *        .build());
+   *
+   * }
+ * + * @param args {@link ComposeObjectArgs} object. + * @return {@link ObjectWriteResponse} object. + * @throws ErrorResponseException thrown to indicate S3 service returned an error response. + * @throws IllegalArgumentException throws to indicate invalid argument passed. + * @throws InsufficientDataException thrown to indicate not enough data available in InputStream. + * @throws InternalException thrown to indicate internal library error. + * @throws InvalidBucketNameException thrown to indicate invalid bucket name passed. + * @throws InvalidKeyException thrown to indicate missing of HMAC SHA-256 library. + * @throws InvalidResponseException thrown to indicate S3 service returned invalid or no error + * response. + * @throws IOException thrown to indicate I/O error on S3 operation. + * @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException thrown to indicate missing of MD5 or SHA-256 digest library. + * @throws XmlParserException thrown to indicate XML parsing error. + */ + public ObjectWriteResponse composeObject(ComposeObjectArgs args) + throws ErrorResponseException, IllegalArgumentException, InsufficientDataException, + InternalException, InvalidBucketNameException, InvalidKeyException, + InvalidResponseException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, ServerException, + XmlParserException { + + checkWriteRequestSse(args.sse());

timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: You would need to use headers() not extraHeaders(). headers member data is updated in ComposeSource.buildHeaders()
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: sseHeaders is always empty. We don't need to add that.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: copyObject() only works with one source and without range. You would need to fix it accordingly.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText:
We are providing core level support by protected. Any reason ti change it to private?
Create one more method with Multimap than change it here.
timeline.author: balamurugana
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -8156,19 +8244,29 @@ protected String uploadPart(
    * @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException thrown to indicate missing of MD5 or SHA-256 digest library.
    * @throws XmlParserException thrown to indicate XML parsing error.
    */
-  protected String uploadPartCopy(
+  private String uploadPartCopy(

timeline.bodyText:
You would need to do if (args.sources.size() == 1 && src.offset() == null && src.length() == null) {
No need to use sources.get(0) because src is already pointing to sources.get(0)
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText:
Isn't it headers.putAll(args.headers()) ? Not sure why there is no compiler error to this line.
Why is it required to create combined headers here? Can't you use them directly like .extraHeaders(args.extraHeaders()).headers(args.headers()) ?
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText:
use createMultipartUpload() like String uploadId = createMultipartUpload(args.bucket(), args.region(), args.object(), args.genHeaders(), args.extraQueryParams());
move this line at 1242
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Isn't it headers.putAll(args.headers()) ? Not sure why there is no compiler error to this line.
timeline.author: balamurugana
